001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
004import java.util.concurrent.Executor;
005import java.util.function.Supplier;
006
007/**
008 * Helper methods for creating asynchronous calls using {@link CompletableFuture}. Since the
009 * synchronous methods in {@link AbstractRpcClient} throw checked exceptions this interface
010 * provides wrapper support to make it easier to convert them to async calls.
011 */
012public interface AsyncSupport {
013    /**
014     * Supply async for a ThrowingSupplier by catching exceptions and completing exceptionally.
015     *
016     * @param throwingSupplier Supplier of T that can throw an exception
017     * @param <T> return type
018     * @return A completable future, returning T
019     */
020    default <T> CompletableFuture<T> supplyAsync(ThrowingSupplier<T> throwingSupplier) {
021        return supplyAsync(throwingSupplier, getDefaultAsyncExecutor());
022    }
023
024    /**
025     * Supply async for a ThrowingSupplier by catching exceptions and completing exceptionally.
026     *
027     * @param throwingSupplier Supplier of T that can throw an exception
028     * @param executor Executor to run the Supplier
029     * @param <T> return type
030     * @return A completable future, returning T
031     */
032    default <T> CompletableFuture<T> supplyAsync(ThrowingSupplier<T> throwingSupplier, Executor executor) {
033        return AsyncSupport.supplyCatchingAsync(throwingSupplier, executor);
034    }
035
036    /**
037     * Return the default executor for supplying asynchronicity.
038     *
039     * @return An executor.
040     */
041    default Executor getDefaultAsyncExecutor() {
042        return (Runnable r) -> new Thread(r).start();
043    }
044
045    static <T> CompletableFuture<T> supplyCatchingAsync(ThrowingSupplier<T> throwingSupplier, Executor executor) {
046        CompletableFuture<T> future = new CompletableFuture<>();
047        executor.execute(() -> {
048            try {
049                T result = throwingSupplier.getThrows();
050                future.complete(result);
051            } catch (Exception e) {
052                future.completeExceptionally(e);
053            }
054        });
055        return future;
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Subinterface of {@link Supplier} for Lambdas which throw exceptions.
060     * Can be used for two purposes:
061     * 1. To cast a lambda that throws an exception to a {@link Supplier} and
062     * automatically wrapping any exceptions with {@link RuntimeException}.
063     * 2. As a {@code FunctionalInterface} where a lambda that throws exceptions is
064     * expected or allowed.
065     *
066     * @param <T>
067     */
068    @FunctionalInterface
069    interface ThrowingSupplier<T> extends Supplier<T> {
070
071        /**
072         * Gets a result wrapping checked Exceptions with {@link RuntimeException}
073         * @return a result
074         */
075        @Override
076        default T get() {
077            try {
078                return getThrows();
079            } catch (final Exception e) {
080                throw new RuntimeException(e);
081            }
082        }
083
084        /**
085         * Gets a result.
086         *
087         * @return a result
088         * @throws Exception Any checked Exception
089         */
090        T getThrows() throws Exception;
091    }
092}
